description: eSIM is a virtual electronics simulator developed by FOSSEE (IIT Bombay) for learning circuit design and simulation. It uses Ngspice for backend simulation and runs in a browser.
example: Simulate a common emitter amplifier using Ngspice and visualize output graph.
parameters: Circuit file, type of analysis (AC, DC, Transient)
notes: Requires modern browser, designed for academic purposes.
use_case: Education, training, virtual labs in electronics and communication engineering.

description: KiCad or Ngspice dependencies not installed properly
Installation fails due to insufficient permissions
eSim commands not found in terminal
eSIM not loading properly in browser
example: Use Chrome Firefox or Safari latest versions
pip install PyQt5 matplotlib numpy scipy

description: Schematic cannot be converted to SPICE netlist
notes: All components must have SPICE models

description: Component SPICE model missing from library
Simulation runs too long and times out

example: Break large circuit into smaller blocks
Ensure no zero-value resistors or capacitors

notes: Fix all ERC errors before simulation

example: Add junction dots at wire intersections
Set R1 R2 for resistors V1 for voltage source
Add junction dots where wires should connect

notes: Use R key for quick rotation
Use consistent grid for neat schematics

Map schematic symbol to PCB footprint

example: Reduce number of plot points in analysis
Set correct path to model files
Verify all model parameters are realistic
Set up proper AC analysis parameters
Check time step and stop time
Set up DC source sweep parameters
Verify all DC sources and connections

notes: Ensure all parts have part numbers
